ca.mcgill.ecse211.RingRetrieval

Class CheckColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.RingRetrieval.CheckColor

  • public class CheckColor
extends java.lang.Object
    Once the motor has reached the ring, this method uses a computed gaussian distribution and the light sensor to determine the ring color
    Author:
    Hieu Chau Nguyen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void colorDetection()
      This method assumes the robot is close enough to the ring, It makes the robot slightly move around to record multiple samples using the fetchColor method.
      private static void fetchColor(int elevation)
      This method records multiple samples, and implements a filter to ignore values too low caused by ambient lighting.

      Check if the robot finished detecting the color

        public CheckColor()

    • Method Detail

      • finishDetect

        public static boolean finishDetect()
        Check if the robot finished detecting the color
        Returns:
        Boolean value true if color detection is finished, false otherwise.

      • restartChecker

        public static void restartChecker()
        Restart the checker for stability reason

      • getDetectedColor

        public static int getDetectedColor()
        Get the value of the detected Color
        Returns:
        Integer value of the colour, 0 if no colour has been detected.

      • getElevation

        public static int getElevation()
        Get the elevation of the detected colour
        Returns:
        1 for low elevation, 2 for high elevation, 0 if no colour has been detected.

      • colorDetection

        public static void colorDetection()
        This method assumes the robot is close enough to the ring, It makes the robot slightly move around to record multiple samples using the fetchColor method. It sets the variable detect to the value of the detected ring

      • fetchColor

        private static void fetchColor(int elevation)
        This method records multiple samples, and implements a filter to ignore values too low caused by ambient lighting.
